hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Carpenter - Finish Carpenter - Framer - Joiner - Shipwright (wood)
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Cabinet maker - 7522 - Wheelwright - 7522

hr_isco_codes.title: Building frame and related trades workers not elsewhere classified
hr_isco_codes.definition: This unit group covers building frame and related trades workers not classified elsewhere in Minor group 711, Building frame and related trades workers. For instance the group includes steeplejacks, scaffolders and demolition workers.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Skilled demolition worker - Scaffolder - Steeplejack
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Construction labourer - 9313 - Demolition labourer- 9313

hr_isco_codes.title: Building finishers and related trades workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Building finishers and related trades workers cover, apply or install, maintain and repair roofs, floors, walls, insulation systems, glass in windows or other frames, as well as plumbing, piping and electrical systems in buildings and other structures.

hr_isco_codes.title: Roofers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Roofers build and repair roofs on all types of buildings using one or more kinds of materials.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Asphalt Roofer - Metal Roofer - Slate Roofer - Tile Roofer - Roof fixer - Thatcher

hr_isco_codes.title: Floor layers and tile setters
hr_isco_codes.definition: Floor layers and tile setters install, maintain and repair flooring, and cover floors, walls and other surfaces with tiles or mosaic panels for decorative or other purposes.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Parquetry worker - Marble setter - Tile setter - Carpet layer

hr_isco_codes.title: Plasterers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Plasterers install, maintain and repair plasterboard in buildings, and apply decorative and protective coverings of plaster, cement and similar material to the interiors and exteriors of structures.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Plasterer - Ornamental Plasterer - Stucco Plasterer - Fibrous Plasterer - Solid Plasterer

hr_isco_codes.title: Insulation workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Insulation workers apply and repair insulating materials to buildings, boilers, pipes or refrigeration and air-conditioning equipment.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Insulation worker - Acoustic insulation worker - Boiler and pipe Insulation worker - Refrigeration and air-conditioning equipment Insulation worker - Insulation Installer

hr_isco_codes.title: Glaziers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Glaziers measure, cut, finish, fit and install flat glass and mirrors.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Autoglazier - Glazier - Roofing glazier - Vehicle glazier
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Glass cutter -7315 - Glass finisher -7315

hr_isco_codes.title: Plumbers and pipe fitters
hr_isco_codes.definition: Plumbers and pipe fitters assemble, install, repair and maintain pipe systems, fittings and fixtures for water, gas, drainage, sewerage systems, and hydraulic and pneumatic equipment.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Pipe fitter - Pipe layer - Plumber - Drain technician
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Air conditioning and refrigeration mechanics - 7126

hr_isco_codes.title: Air conditioning and refrigeration mechanics
hr_isco_codes.definition: Air conditioning and refrigeration mechanics assemble, install, maintain and repair air conditioning and refrigeration systems and equipment.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Air conditioning equipment mechanic - Refrigeration mechanic
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Ventilation pipe fitter - 7126 - Plumbers and pipe filters - 7126

hr_isco_codes.title: Painters, building structure cleaners and related trades workers

hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: preparing surfaces and applying paint and similar materials to buildings and other structures; applying paint or varnish to vehicles or various manufactured articles, usually with a hand-spraying device; covering interior

hr_isco_codes.title: Painters and related workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Painters and related workers prepare surfaces of buildings and other structures for painting, apply protective and decorative coats of paint or similar materials, or cover interior walls and ceilings of buildings with wallpaper or other finishes.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Building painter - Paperhanger

hr_isco_codes.title: Spray painters and varnishers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Spray painters and varnishers operate spray painting and varnishing equipment to apply protective coatings to manufactured items or structures.

hr_isco_codes.definition: Building structure cleaners clean exterior surfaces of buildings and other structures, and remove soot from chimneys.

hr_isco_codes.title: Sheet and structural metal workers, moulders and welders, and related workers

hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: making moulds and cores for casting metal; casting, welding and shaping metal parts; making and repairing articles of sheet metal such as sheet steel, copper, tin, or brass; installing, erecting, maintaining and repairing

hr_isco_codes.title: Metal moulders and coremakers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Metal moulders and coremakers make moulds and cores for casting metal.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Coremaker - Metal casting moulder

hr_isco_codes.title: Welders and flame cutters
hr_isco_codes.definition: Welders and flame cutters weld and cut metal parts using gas flame, electric arc and other sources of heat to melt and cut, or to melt and fuse metal.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Brazier - Flame cutter - Welder

hr_isco_codes.title: Sheet metal workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Sheet metal workers make, install and repair articles and parts of articles made out of sheet metal such as sheet steel, copper, tin, brass, aluminium, zinc or galvanised iron.

hr_isco_codes.title: Structural metal preparers and erectors
hr_isco_codes.definition: Structural metal preparers and erectors assemble, erect and dismantle structural metal frames of buildings and other structures.

hr_isco_codes.definition: Riggers and cable splicers assemble rigging gear to move and position equipment and structural components, or install and maintain cables, ropes and wires on construction sites, buildings or other structures

hr_isco_codes.title: Motor vehicle mechanics and repairers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Motor vehicle mechanics and repairers fit, install, maintain, service and repair engines and the mechanical and related equipment of passenger cars, delivery trucks, motorcycles and other motor vehicles.

hr_isco_codes.title: Civil engineering labourers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Civil engineering labourers perform routine tasks in connection with the building and maintenance of roads, railways, dams and other civil engineering projects.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Construction labourer (civil engineering) - Maintenance labourer (dams) - Earthmoving labourer

hr_isco_codes.title: Building construction labourers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Building construction labourers perform routine tasks in connection with building construction and demolition work.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Bricklayer's assistant - Construction labourer (building work) - Demolition Labourer - Hod carrier
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Bricklayer - 7112 - House builder - 7111 - Building wrecker - 7119

hr_isco_codes.title: Manufacturing labourers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Manufacturing labourers perform a variety of manual tasks in manufacturing, assist the work of machine operators and assemblers, and undertake product-sorting and hand-assembling of components.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: packing material and various products by hand; filling bottles, boxes, bags and other containers with products by hand; labelling products and containers by hand; conveying goods, material, equipment to work area; cleaning
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9321 Hand packers 9329 Manufacturing labourers not elsewhere classified

hr_isco_codes.title: Hand packers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Hand packers weigh, pack and label materials and products by hand.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Labeller (hand) - Packer (hand) - Wrapper (hand)
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Labelling machine operator - 8183 - Packing machine operator - 8183 - Wraping machine operator - 8183

hr_isco_codes.title: Manufacturing labourers not elsewhere classified
hr_isco_codes.definition: Manufacturing labourers not elsewhere classified assist the work of machine operators and assemblers and perform a variety of manual tasks in manufacturing, excluding packing and labelling finished products.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Bottle sorter - Factory hand - Material handler - Stacker
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Assembler, electrical equipment - 8212 - Assembler, electronic equipment - 8212 - Assembler, leather products - 8219 - Assembler, rubber products - 8219 - Hand packer - 9321

hr_isco_codes.title: Transport and storage labourers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Transport and storage labourers propel cycles and similar vehicles and drive animal-drawn vehicles to transport passengers or goods, drive animal-drawn machinery, handle freight and baggage and stock shelves
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: propelling cycles and similar vehicles to transport passengers or goods, driving animal-drawn vehicles to transport passengers or goods, driving animal-drawn machinery, carrying out freight handling by hand, and stocking
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9331 Hand and pedal vehicle drivers 9332 Drivers of animal-drawn vehicles and machinery 9333 Freight handlers 9334 Shelf fillers

hr_isco_codes.title: Hand and pedal vehicle drivers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Hand or pedal vehicle drivers propel cycles and similar vehicles to transport passengers or goods.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Driver, pedal vehicle - Driver, cycle rickshaw - Puller, rickshaw
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Bicycle racer - 3421 - Motorcycle rider - 8321

hr_isco_codes.title: Drivers of animal-drawn vehicles and machinery
hr_isco_codes.definition: Drivers of animal-drawn vehicles and machinery drive animal-drawn vehicles to transport passengers or goods, as well as animal-drawn machinery usually in connection with farming.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Driver, animal-drawn vehicle - Driver, animal train - Mahout
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Jockey - 3421

hr_isco_codes.title: Freight handlers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Freight handlers carry out tasks such as packing, carrying, loading and unloading furniture and other household items, or loading and unloading ship and aircraft cargoes and other freight, or carrying and stacking goods in various warehouses.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Handler, freight
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Operator, crane -8343 - Operator, truck/lifting - 8344

hr_isco_codes.title: Shelf fillers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Shelf fillers stock shelves and display areas and keep stock clean and in order in supermarkets and other retail and wholesale shops.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Filler, stock - Handler, stock

hr_isco_codes.title: Food preparation assistants
hr_isco_codes.definition: Food preparation assistants prepare and cook to order a small variety of pre-cooked food or beverages, clear tables, clean kitchen areas and wash dishes.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed by workers in this sub major group usually include: preparing simple or pre-prepared foods and beverages such as sandwiches, pizzas, fish and chips, salads, and coffee; washing, cutting, measuring and mixing foods for cooking; operating c
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this sub major group are classified into the following minor group:
941 Food preparation assistants

hr_isco_codes.title: Food preparation assistants
hr_isco_codes.definition: Food preparation assistants prepare and cook to order small variety of pre-cooked food or beverages, clear tables, clean kitchen areas and wash dishes.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: preparing simple or pre-prepared foods and beverages such as sandwiches, pizzas, fish and chips, salads, and coffee; washing, cutting, measuring and mixing foods for cooking; operating cooking equipment such as grills, mi
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9411 Fast food preparers 9412 Kitchen helpers

hr_isco_codes.title: Fast food preparers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Fast food preparers prepare and cook to order a limited range of foods or beverages that involve simple preparation processes and a small number of ingredients. They may take orders from customers and serve at counters or tables.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Fast-food cook - Short order Cook
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Chef-3434 - Cook-5120 - Food service counter attendant - 5246

hr_isco_codes.title: Kitchen helpers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Kitchen helpers clear tables, clean kitchen areas, wash dishes, preparing ingredients and perform other duties to assist workers who prepare or serve food and beverages.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks include - (a) cleaning kitchens, food preparation areas and service areas; (b) assisting cooks and chefs in preparation of food by washing, peeling, chopping, cutting up measuring and mixing ingredients, (c) assembling dishes for service. (d)
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Hand dish washer - Kitchen assistant - Kitchen hand - Kitchen porter - Kitchen steward - Pantry attendant
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Cook - 5120 - Fast food preparer - 9411

hr_isco_codes.title: Street and related sales and service workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Street and related sales and service workers provide sell goods, excluding food for immediate consumptions, and provide a variety of services on streets and in other public places such as stations.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks include: buying or making various items for sale; loading and unloading items for sale and transporting them; obtaining the materials necessary to perform services; approaching people on the street to offer goods or services; cleaning and polishing
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this sub-major group are classified into the following minor groups:
951 Street and related service workers 952 Street vendors (excluding food)

hr_isco_codes.title: Street and related service workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Street and related service workers provide a variety of services on streets and in other public places, including cleaning shoes, washing car windows, running errands, looking after property, and providing other on-the-spot street services.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks include: obtaining the materials necessary to perform services; approaching people on the street to offer services; cleaning and polishing shoes; cleaning and polishing car windows; running errands; assisting drivers to find a parking place and ens
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9510 Street and related service workers

hr_isco_codes.title: Street and related service workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Street and related service workers provide a variety of services on streets and in other public places, including cleaning shoes, washing car windows, running errands, handing out leaflets, looking after property, and providing other on-the-spot street s
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Errand boy - Shoe-polisher - Car window washer - Car guard - Leaflet distributor - Free newspaper distributor
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Leaflet and newspaper deliverer - 9621 Forecourt attendant - 5245

hr_isco_codes.title: Street vendors (excluding food)
hr_isco_codes.definition: Street vendors (excluding food) sell a usually limited range of goods (excluding food for immediate consumption) in streets and public places such as stations, cinemas or theatres.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include: buying or receiving items for sale, or making simple items; loading and unloading basket, tray, push-cart, bicycle, hand truck or other vehicle, to transport goods to the streets or public places such as stations or cinem
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9520 Street vendors (excluding food)

hr_isco_codes.title: Street vendors (excluding food)
hr_isco_codes.definition: Street vendors (excluding food) sell a usually limited range of goods (excluding food for immediate consumption) in streets and public places such as stations, cinemas or theatres.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Hawker - Pedlar - Newspaper vendor
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: Market salesperson - 5211 Street stall salesperson - 5211 Street food vendor - 5212 Free newspaper distributor - 9510
hr_isco_codes.notes: Vendors from street and market stalls of fresh food products not intended for immediate consumption (such as fruit, vegetables, meat and dairy products) are classified in unit group 5211 Stall and market salespersons. Vendors from street and market stalls

hr_isco_codes.title: Refuse workers and other elementary workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Refuse workers and other elementary workers collect garbage from buildings, yards, streets and other public places or keep streets and other public places or perform odd jobs for private households or establishments.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks include - collecting, loading and unloading garbage; sweeping streets, parks and other public places; chopping firewood; carrying water; beating dust out of carpets and performing other odd-job tasks.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this sub-major group are classified into the following minor groups:
961 Refuse workers 962 Other elementary workers

hr_isco_codes.title: Refuse workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Refuse workers collect, process and recycle garbage from buildings, yards, streets and other public places, or keep streets and other public places clean.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Taks usually include: collecting, loading and unloading garbage; sweeping streets, parks and other public places; sorting and recycling garbage such as paper, glass, plastic or aluminium.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9611 Garbage and recycling collectors 9612 Refuse sorters 9613 Sweepers and related labourers

hr_isco_codes.title: Garbage and recycling collectors
hr_isco_codes.definition: Garbage collectors collect and remove rubbish and items for recycling from buildings, yards, streets and other places.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Collector, refuse - Dustman - Dustwoman
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Garbage truck driver- 8332

hr_isco_codes.title: Refuse sorters
hr_isco_codes.definition: Refuse sorters identify, collect and sort discarded items suitable for recycling at dump sites and recycling enterprises or in buildings, streets and other public places.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: (a) searching through refuse and collecting items for recycling from dump sites, domestic, commercial and industrial premises or from public places such as streets; (b) sorting cardboard, paper, glass, plastic, aluminium or other recyclable materials by
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: Recycling worker Scrap merchant Waste picker
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: Refuse collector - 9611 Street sweeper - 9613

hr_isco_codes.title: Sweepers and related labourers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Sweepers and related labourers sweep and clean streets, parks, airports, stations and other public places.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Sweeper, park - Sweeper, street

hr_isco_codes.title: Other elementary workers
hr_isco_codes.definition: Other elementary workers deliver and carry messages and packages, collect money and stock vending machines, read meters, collect water and firewood, collect and issue tickets for parking or events.
hr_isco_codes.tasks_include: Tasks performed usually include- chopping wood, collecting water and firewood; delivering messages, packages and other items within or between establishments, or elsewhere; performing duties as a post-runner; issuing and collecting tickets and passes; c
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations:
Occupations in this minor group are classified into the following unit groups:
9621 Messengers, package deliverers and luggage porters 9622 Odd job persons 9623 Meter readers and vending-machine collectors 9624 Water and firewood collectors 9629

hr_isco_codes.title: Messengers, package deliverers and luggage porters
hr_isco_codes.definition: Messengers, package deliverers and luggage porters carry and deliver messages, packages and other items within an establishment or between establishments, to households and elsewhere, or carry luggage especially at hotels, stations and airports.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Newspaper deliverer - Messenger - Luggage porter - Post-runner
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Mail carrier - 4412 - Postman/woman - 4412

hr_isco_codes.title: Odd job persons
hr_isco_codes.definition: Odd job persons clean, paint and maintain buildings, grounds and facilities, and undertake simple repairs.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Odd-job person - Handyperson, - Hotel useful

hr_isco_codes.title: Meter readers and vending-machine collectors
hr_isco_codes.definition: Meter readers and vending-machine collectors stock vending machines and collect money from them or from parking meters and other coin-boxes, or read electricity, gas or water meters.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Vending machine collector - Meter reader

hr_isco_codes.title: Water and firewood collectors
hr_isco_codes.definition: Water and firewood collectors collect water and firewood and transport them on foot or using hand or animal carts.
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Firewood collector - Water collector

hr_isco_codes.title: Elementary workers not elsewhere classified
hr_isco_codes.definition: This unit group covers elementary workers not classified elsewhere in major group 9, Elementary workers. For instance, the group includes those who issue and collect parking or admission tickets, provide personal items to patrons or customers in cloak
hr_isco_codes.included_occupations: Examples of the occupations classified here: - Usher - Parking attendant - Fairground attendant - Cloak room attendant - Ticket collectors
hr_isco_codes.excluded_occupations: Some related occupations classified elsewhere: - Parking valet - 8322
